title: Château d'Agassac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: From vineyards surrounding the medieval moated castle, this wine is well balanced, rich and yet structured. It has great blackberry fruit and dry tannins for aging and it's coming together well. Drink from 2022.

title: Château d'Armailhac 2015  Pauillac
description: This wine is firm, almost classically Pauillac in its black currants and acidity. The tannins are present behind the bright fruit and crisp texture. This wine has a dry core that will need to soften. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Poesia 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Located in the east of Saint-Émilion, this estate was formerly know as Haut-Villet. It is a powerful expression of ripe Cabernet Franc, giving a perfumed character that is already well established in this rich, fruity wine. It should age well, so drink from 2023.

title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Ripe Merlot dominates this wine from a small property. It has great, powerful tannins and some sumptuous blackberry flavors, resulting in a dense texture. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Layers of apricots and fresh oranges give this wine a crisp aspect as well as richness. A touch of spice graces the ripe, honeyed fruits, while great acidity keeps the palate refreshed.

title: Château Cissac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is going to be an excellent early-drinking wine. Its wood and rich, dark fruits are already well-integrated, giving it a dark, spicy character. It will need several years to be drinkable, certainly not before 2023.

title: Château la Tour de Bessan 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. A finely crafted wine from an estate owned by a member of the Lurton family. It is dense, pure with great black-currant fruit and layers of firm tannins. Developing well, the wine should be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a bright, crisp wine, with intense citrus acidity as well as rich apricot and quince flavors. It is textured and full of minerality, with a crisp finish. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Olivier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a dark, smoky wine, packed with dark berry notes, this is rich and full. Its tannins are powerful and will need taming. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Gloria 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. While this wine has plenty of wood flavors, the fruit weight justifies it. It is rich with good spice and balanced acidity. It will develop relatively quickly, drink from 2023.

title: Château Lalande-Borie 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Reduced quantities due to frost have added some concentration and certainly brought out fine, elegant tannins. The black fruit flavors are warm, rich and generous backed by a solid structure to balance the ripe fruit.

title: Château Montrose 2017 La Dame de Montrose Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This generous and juicy wine is open, luscious and full of great black fruit notes. The equal quantities of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot give both richness and a soft texture. The tannins are succulent and will allow the wine to develop quickly, drink from 2021.
designation: La Dame de Montrose Barrel Sample

title: Château Nenin 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is juicy, with layers of attractive black fruit and soft tannins. It offers hints of spice and toast balanced by plenty of acidity. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Beauregard 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is an attractive, perfumed wine, with generous tannins and blackberry fruits. The acidity of the vintage is very present and contrasts with the firm structure in the background. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Barrel Sample Les Hauts de Smith  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. There are dusty tannins and pure, ripe black fruit flavors in this wine, with a touch of spice from the new wood that balances the generous fruits. Drink from 2023.
designation: Barrel Sample Les Hauts de Smith

title: Alloro 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: All Dijon clones from the Alloro vineyard, this tightly wound effort mixes tree-fruit flesh and skin flavors in a compact balanced wine with some good years of life ahead. There's a pleasing nuttiness resonating through the finish, from a small percentage that was fermented in new French oak. Give it an extra year or two in bottle and it should open up nicely.

title: Ayoub 2015 Memoirs Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This lovely wine shows its dark side throughout, mixing black fruits with strong flavors of black coffee. Barrel aging, just under a year in one-quarter new French oak, brings up flavors of dark chocolate and chicory. It's delicious and substantial, ready for drinking over the next half decade or longer.

title: Benziger 2015 Signaterra La Reyna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes go into the making of this light and delicate wine—a fine example of coastal cooling. Layered in earthy rose petal and cardamom, it shows length and breadth around a quiet core of tart rhubarb and pomegranate.

title: Berlucchi NV '61 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: A blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Pinot Nero, this refined sparkler opens with heady aromas of white wild flower, citrus and a whiff of bread crust. On the lively palate, fresh acidity brightens creamy white peach, Golden Delicious apple and lemon drop. A brioche note wraps up the finish.

title: Berlucchi NV '61 Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Bright and savory, this refreshing, polished sparkler boasts alluring aromas of juicy raspberry, wild cherry, baking spice and a whiff of bread crust. The inviting aromas follow over to the vibrant palate along with a continuous refined perlage. A tangy candied nectarine note closes the finish.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Strangenberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: This is fresh, aromatic and primary in cherry aromas. The same luscious, generous fruit also dominates the juicy palate. There is freshness to balance this abundance but this is hedonistic and fruit driven to the core, with a cinnamon undertone. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Grand A du Petit Léon Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The nose offers lovely touches of stone, fern and white pepper, with the freshness of green apple. There is something pristine about this wine, something light, clear and utterly moreish. The finish is clean and dry.

title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Doctor Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: While feather light and ethereal in texture, there's an abundance of plump, juicy yellow cherry, guava and even strawberry fruitiness here. It's unabashedly forward and fruity yet racy and fresh. The finish lingers on a lovely floral tone.

title: Dr. Hermann 2016 Erdener Herzlei Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hints of caramelized sugar, pollen and orange peel glaze this succulent, lip-smacking Riesling. Its delicate sweetness is bolstered by sunny squirts of orange and yellow peach, but balanced neatly against a solid backbone of lime acidity. A deeply penetrating spätlese with a long burnt-sugar finish.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: A cool, steely undertone intensifies crisp, yellow stone fruit and lime on the nose and palate. With electric, sweet-tart darts of honey and nectar, this is a piercing, concentrated wine that has a long lime-pith finish.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Intoxicating notes of exotic spice, smoke and crushed earth intensify flavors of pristine white grapefruit and peach in this tantalizing kabinett. Deeply penetrating in fruit and vibrantly balanced in acidity, it finishes with a long, crystalline finish.

title: Enrico Gatti 2011 Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Scents of mature tropical fruit, walnut and bread crust segue over to the dry savory palate together with yellow apple and lemon zest. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors while an elegant perlage lends finesse.

title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Dusty earth and smoke tones are predominant on first whiff but open gradually, offering a succession of ripening fruits from fresh lime and gooseberry to crunchy peach and pink grapefruit. It's a spry, taut wine, with scintillating acidity and a long crystalline finish.

title: Gård 2015 Reverence Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 49% Syrah, 38% Grenache and a whopping 13% Viognier, with the latter expressing itself on both the aromas and palate. The wine pops, with notes of freshly peeled orange, stargazer lilly, gravel, olive, smoked meat, blueberry and boysenberry. Soft and sumptuous, the palate shows a lot of elegance and expression along with an extended finish.

title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Piesporter Treppchen von den Terrassen Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced aromas of struck match and flint belie the intensity of fresh grapefruit and lemon at the core of this delicately off-dry wine. It's more earth and herbs than forward or fruity but there's a savory intensity here that's beguiling. It's a wine that should improve with some cellaring, try after 2020.
